main event: A bright, shiny, star-shaped object was observed moving slowly and erratically in the sky near Montgomery, Alabama in 1961.
interesting points: The object was described as a 'head of pin' or 'pinwheel' shape, and was very bright.
An old man in a field also saw the object moving towards the southern horizon.
The object exhibited slow, erratic movements and did not appear to be an aircraft.
A T-33 jet was dispatched to investigate the sighting, but the pilot did not report seeing anything.
The sighting was reported to last around 15 minutes before the object went out of view.
witnesses: an unidentified observer and an old man in a field
